event:
Life is meaningless and full of pain.

I hate it when both my teams lose.

The Giants loss was especially painful.  To the Seahawks and their backup qb... ack... and with victory only eight yards away...

Still love Victor Cruz.  Even more so.

comments.article: But the 49ers! The 49ers, George! This NFL season is magical and full of joy!
comments.subject: NFL

comments.article: Indeed, that game was awesome.  It's been a while since I saw them beat anyone like that.
comments.subject: Re: NFL

comments.article: "Life is meaningless and full of pain" pretty much sums up the way I feel every time you kill a Stark... or any other cool character who doesn't deserve to get screwed over. But even so; my condolences. :D
what do you find in Starks? Lots of pride, no brains at all.
It's wonderful to be a Packers fan these days.

That was karma for the Starks....
:p
I fear every time your teams loose you will kill off someone we love. *shudders*
The Jets lost and so did my Seminoles. You should be happy.

Every time both NY teams lose, a Stark dies.

But at least the Yankees aren't in the playoffs anymore...
You think that's painful? On Saturday England were beaten by France, France! and knocked out of the Rugby World Cup.

Maybe this will cheer you up! Yet another Game of Thrones RPG :-)

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hftnySHVnF0

Greetings from Germany

Not only do you kill off my cherished characters, but you knock the 'Hawks. If I had i glove right now I would slap you with it and challenge you to a duel.

-Murphy
You should watch European soccer. :P

All he'd get out of soccer is how to write about people who fake injuries to waste play time. ;)

Now, if you want to turn George onto soccer, he should watch WOMEN'S soccer. Those ladies don't flop (unless they're from Brazil).
Please don't kill any main characters in "The Song" while in this mood.
My strangulation was excellent last week - and this week I get to start learning 18th Century sword and some rapier and dagger stuff ;) Hooray - life is full of joy and fake violence :)
comments.subject: OK - so to cheer you up ...

comments.article: ...because I am an Eagles fan. Nuff said. The NFC East is not looking good this year...
comments.subject: I feel your pain, George...

comments.article: Welcome to my hell. (Broncos fan here.)
comments.subject: Re: I feel your pain, George...

comments.article: If it means anything, the Jets did a damn fine job. I was seriously concerned that Brady and Co. weren't going to be able to function with Welker so shut down. So.. at least the game was a good one!

Look on the bright side, George. At least your boys' losses weren't because they dressed the one person in the known universe who didn't know Ryan Fitzpatrick was desperately trying to sucker the Eagles into jumping the play.
Hey, at least Wun Wun has torn apart Ser Patrek :) They're vindicated.

I personally am a Patriots fan, so i'm happy about their win, but you have to look at it from an objective view - both the jets and the patriots were trying to give the game away - the jets just tried harder.  i've never seen such pathetic penalties - on both sides...  3 and 24 (or so), and instead of an incomplete pass (which it would have been), it results in a 38 yard pass interference penalty?  dude - how can anyone doubt that both teams were trying their damnedest to give the game away???
comments.subject: not entirely meaningless....

comments.article: How come the giants make the worst teams look like superbowl contenders.  Look at the cardinals this week.
comments.subject: Giants

comments.article:
I empathize. Its been rough so far. We looks undisciplined & unorganized, but I have to admit, seeing the giants leave first place on the table still gives me reason to believe the division is up for grabs!

Do you have any thoughts on the eagles implosion thus far? lol
comments.subject: Eagles Fan

comments.article: Great! Now another ASoIAF character must die.

Cruz's catch was pretty amazing...of course if Tom Brady had thrown it, then acrobatics would not have been necessary ;)

Go Pats!
comments.subject: Heck of a Catch!

comments.article: I've been very found of the MMA - Try to watch the UFC and see if you like it. You will never feel like that again...
comments.subject: try MMA

comments.article:
I'm sorry for your loss(es).

I just received my copy of Down These Strange Streets in the mail. I'm surprised you haven't blogged its release yet. And please remind me, when is Femmes Fatale/Warrior Women supposed to appear?

Agreed on the G-Men and Cruz.  He was a rookie last year, and he missed most of the year on IR.  Then this year they had a shortened preseason.  In other words, he's still young, he's still learning, and he's still making some rookie mistakes out there, but he looks like a real keeper.  You don't put up three games in a row like that by accident! (Remember's Kiwi's rookie season?  Full of rookie mistakes!)
